media.caption: "Lenore 'snapping' [a photograph]." Newberry Library

text.headline: Lenore Raster in the midwest, 1916-1922
text.text:
This album forms part of the Newberry's collection of the papers of Hermann Raster (1827-1891), a prominent German immigrant, editor, and activist. After political persecution forced him to leave Germany in 1851, he moved to America and eventually settled in Chicago, where he served as the longtime editor of the German-language Illinois Staats-Zeitung (Illinois State Newspaper). 

Lenore Raster Aasgaard (1899-1987) was Hermann's granddaughter. Although only a second-generation American, this photo album from her teens and early 20s shows her thoroughly at home in the U.S., traversing the country by steamboat, automobile, and horse-drawn carriage. 

Images from: Lenore Raster travel photo album, 1916-1922. Newberry Library View at Internet Archive | Map: General railway map engraved expressly for the official guide of the railways and steam navigation lines of the United States..., 1918. Library of Congress  View online

Help with historical scholarship! Create or review transcriptions to make handwritten letters and diaries from the Raster family and others easier to find, search, and browse. Start now at Newberry Transcribe
